channel.title: Making an RSPS
channel.description:
After leaving the Habbo Hotel private server business I am desperate to go into developing RSPS. All guides are pointing toward how to make an RSPS but it's got nothing about editing. Things such as placing NPC's, changing skill XP & changing magic teleports etc.
Even making people ranks I can't figure out! Is there an ULTIMATE guide which tells you how to do all these or something? I can normally pick up on things like this pretty fast.
Thanks! John.

[/quote]

cool life kid? TROLL MOAR?

item.title: Making an RSPS
item.dc:creator: @brandonscarinfo brandonscarinfo
item.description:
@brandonscarinfo wrote:

[quote=“JohnH, post:17, topic:378881”]Hi thanks for the reply!

I am having ease getting on the server and I can only connect using mopar’s client, I was wondering if there is any clients with few files inside and just a run.bat but you can edit it to connect to my IP.

If so, does anyone have a link to this file, or a guide on how to do this.[/quote]

we just told you to preset the client. any client should work for this as long as it is the same revision as your source. Please use search bar, there are hundreds of threads that are about changing the IP

Read full topic

item.title: Making an RSPS
item.dc:creator: @JohnH JohnH
item.description:
@JohnH wrote:

Hi thanks for the reply!

I am having ease getting on the server and I can only connect using mopar’s client, I was wondering if there is any clients with few files inside and just a run.bat but you can edit it to connect to my IP.

If so, does anyone have a link to this file, or a guide on how to do this.

Read full topic

item.title: Making an RSPS
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

Oh, you’re talking about pre-setting the clients ip. You do this before you archive your client, you go into (client.class?) or gui.java and look for it and pre-set it.

Read full topic

item.title: Making an RSPS
item.dc:creator: @JohnH JohnH
item.description:
@JohnH wrote:

My ports are forwarded already and it’s already open, but when RSPS’s have websites etc and they tell you to download their client, you just log straight in without typing the IP of the server in. This is what I’m asking.

And the whole is the look of the interface client side

Read full topic

item.title: Making an RSPS
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

If you’re connecting to local host you don’t have to put in and specific ip, if you’re going to host it for the public you’d have to port forward and then edit the clients ip address, etc.

Otherwise any regular 317 deob will suffice.

Read full topic

item.title: Making an RSPS
item.dc:creator: @JohnH JohnH
item.description:
@JohnH wrote:

Global objects, got it and I know how to. Thanks a lot!!

Only thing I’m really concerned with now is trying to make a client which doesn’t require you to input an IP as it logs in straight to mine.

Also, the interface with the inventory tab, magic tab icons etc - Are they client based or source?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @brandonscarinfo brandonscarinfo
item.description:
@brandonscarinfo wrote:

JohnH:

Thanks a lot I will do. In the tutorials section I can’t find anything with adding basic things like fishing spots, shop NPCs, tree’s, banks etc only complicated things though

They are objects. Theres your hint

item.title: Making an RSPS
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

Editing an rsps private server, there are multiple tutorials. I suggest you start by looking through the tutorial section, however most things in that section only teach you very basic if nothing about java, they only teach you about clustering your server together with shitty quality code. But they are a good way to learn to get use to the rsps packaging (if your server is packaged at all), if you really want to start learning the Java language correctly I suggest skimming through some of the topics in this board. And I also suggest you look/read through the tutorials provided at java oracle, you can find the website on google.

Good luck.

Read full topic

item.title: Making an RSPS
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“JohnH, post:6, topic:378881”][s]I’ve been looking around sources and decided to try and make my own home etc but download a server with GWD Barrows KBD etc already in.

I need to know how to add items such as fishing spots, mining rocks + bank booths aswell as NPC’s that server as shops to specific coords. Any guides for that or is it fairly simple?[/s][/quote]

Biggest mistake, downloading your first server that already has everything in it.

A lot of those servers are relatively buggy, and have lots of glitches that you don’t have the programming experience to fix.

Download a Delta that has a few mini games/shops to start off with, this one is good: http://www.mediafire.com/?mjew9sexzj4

Very easy to program.

It’s going to say the auto-restarter is a virus… its not…

Read full topic
